Material used.Material Name: Brain Tissue from Contursi Kindred Patient IX-51
Material used.Description: Postmortem brain tissue from a patient in the Contursi kindred carrying the A53T a-syn gene mutation was used for immunohistochemical analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Extensive spheroids and Lewy neurites were detected in multiple brain regions, indicating widespread a-syn pathology associated with the A53T mutation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Absence of spheroids and Lewy neurites in brain regions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of spheroids and Lewy neurites in brain regions.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Biochemical Analysis (Sequential Extraction and Western Blotting)

Material used.Material Name: Brain Tissue from Contursi Kindred Patient IX-51
Material used.Description: Frozen brain tissue from multiple regions of a patient in the Contursi kindred carrying the A53T a-syn gene mutation was used for biochemical analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant accumulation of insoluble a-synuclein requiring SDS or formic acid for extraction was observed in multiple brain regions, indicating altered protein solubility due to the A53T mutation.

Basic positive control.Description: Control brain tissue from a pathologically normal brain was used for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: a-Synuclein fully extractable in high salt buffer or with mild detergent.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: a-Synuclein requiring SDS or formic acid for extraction.

Material used.Material Name: Brain Tissue from Contursi Kindred Patient IX-51
Material used.Description: Brain sections from a patient in the Contursi kindred carrying the A53T a-syn gene mutation were used for ultrastructural analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Filamentous ultrastructure of a-synuclein inclusions was observed, confirming fibrillar pathology associated with the A53T mutation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Absence of filamentous structures in brain tissue sections.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of filamentous structures in brain tissue sections.

Material used.Material Name: Recombinant WT and A53T a-Synuclein, Tau T40
Material used.Description: Recombinant wild-type and A53T mutant a-synuclein, along with tau T40 protein, were used for in vitro fibrillization studies.

Readout description.Result Description: The A53T mutation accelerated a-synuclein fibril formation and enhanced tau fibrillization compared to wild-type a-synuclein.

Technical replicates.Description: Four samples (n=4) were analyzed for each condition.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a control for comparison with A53T mutant.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantitative analysis using ImageQuant software for sedimentation analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fibrillization rate comparable to wild-type a-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Accelerated fibrillization rate compared to wild-type a-synuclein.
